intro: Psychotria setistipulata, commonly known as the purple-stemmed psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its dark green, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. Its fruits are red berries that contain seeds, which are dispersed by birds. Psychotria setistipulata is often found in secondary forests and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
